            About this blog
          
          
            
              
              h1 {
                display: none;
              }
              Hi there! Welcome to my blog.
              My name is Djamila and I’m currently in the final year of my PhD. I am investigating how diet is associated with mental and gastrointestinal health, as well as the gut microbiota - the ecosystem of microorganisms residing within our guts
              The study that I’ve been working on for the last several years is called Bugs and Brains: The Gut and Mental Health Study. It is the world’s first study to compare the physiological and microbial profiles of healthy adults to those with irritable bowel syndrome (IBS), anxiety and depression, and those with comorbid IBS and anxiety/depression
              I am passionate about all things food and how we can eat to feel well physically and mentally - how to feed (feel) happy
              Thank you for joining me on this journey! x
            
            
              
              h1 {
                display: none;
              }
              Hi there! Welcome to my blog.
              My name is Djamila and I’m currently in the final year of my PhD. I am investigating how diet is associated with mental and gastrointestinal health, as well as the gut microbiota - the ecosystem of microorganisms residing within our guts
              The study that I’ve been working on for the last several years is called Bugs and Brains: The Gut and Mental Health Study. It is the world’s first study to compare the physiological and microbial profiles of healthy adults to those with irritable bowel syndrome (IBS), anxiety and depression, and those with comorbid IBS and anxiety/depression
              I am passionate about all things food and how we can eat to feel well physically and mentally - how to feed (feel) happy
              Thank you for joining me on this journey! x

articles.title: Published Work
articles.description: A collection of scientific publications and research reports
articles.contents:
d-title {
  display: none;
}


Publications
Bugs and Brains, the Gut and Mental Health Study: a mixed-methods study investigating microbiota composition and function in anxiety, depression and irritable bowel syndrome (Simpson, Schwartz, et al. 2021)
Decoding explicit and implicit representations of health and taste attributes of foods in the human brain (Schubert et al. 2021)
The gut microbiota in anxiety and depression – a systematic review (Simpson, Diaz-arteche, et al. 2021)
Research Reports
The microbiota and our mental health
How to maintain a healthy biome in a Covid-19 world



Schubert, Elektra, Daniel Rosenblatt, Djamila Eliby, Yoshihisa Kashima, Hinze Hogendoorn, and Stefan Bode. 2021. “Decoding explicit and implicit representations of health and taste attributes of foods in the human brain.” Neuropsychologia 162. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.neuropsychologia.2021.108045.


Simpson, Carra A, Carmela Diaz-arteche, Djamila Eliby, Orli S Schwartz, Julian G Simmons, and Caitlin S M Cowan. 2021. “The gut microbiota in anxiety and depression – A systematic review.” Clinical Psychology Review 83 (September 2020): 101943. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.cpr.2020.101943.


Simpson, Carra A, Orli S Schwartz, Djamila Eliby, Catherine A Butler, Bridget L Callaghan, Katherine Huang, Neil O Brien-, et al. 2021. “Bugs and Brains, the Gut and Mental Health Study: a mixed-methods study investigating microbiota composition and function in anxiety , depression and irritable bowel syndrome.” BMJ Open 11:e043221. https://doi.org/10.1136/bmjopen-2020-043221.
